newsitem.title: ITALY: Snia BPD details Snia Fibre share swap.
newsitem.headline: Snia BPD details Snia Fibre share swap.

text.p: Italian chemicals group Snia BPD said the share exchange ratio for its incorporation of subsidiary Snia Fibre would be two ordinary BPD shares for five Fibre ones.
A statement said Snia BPD also intended to make a capital increase for up to 18.3 billion lire.

In the statement from Snia's parent group Fiat, it said the project envisaged "a Snia BPD capital increase to service the exchange, through the issue of two BPD shares with a nominal value of 1,000 lire for five ordinary Fibre shares with a nominal value of 1,000 lire held by minority shareholders."
Snia BPD currently holds 83.68 percent of Snia Fibre's capital.

Under current shareholdings, Snia BPD's shareholders after the incorporation will include Sicind Spa with 46.87 percent of capital, down from its current 48.13 pct, and Mediobanca Spa at 10.88 percent, down from 11.18 percent.
The operation will be put to shareholder approval at a meeting called for May 19 or 23.
